content.text:
# European Education and Culture Executive Agency

The European Education and Culture Executive Agency (formerly the Education, Audiovisual and Culture Executive Agency), or EACEA, is an executive agency of the European Commission located in Brussels, Belgium. It manages parts of the European Commission's funding programmes in education, culture, media, sport, youth, citizenship and humanitarian aid. EACEA has been operational since January 2006.
Organisation
EACEA is supervised by six Directorates-General of the European Commission:
* [https://ec.europa.eu/info/departments/education-youth-sport-and-culture_en Education, Youth, Sport and Culture] (DG EAC)
* [https://ec.europa.eu/info/departments/communications-networks-content-and-technology_en Communications Networks, Content and Technology] (DG CNECT)
* [https://ec.europa.eu/info/departments/justice-and-consumers_en Justice and Consumers] (DG JUST)
* [https://ec.europa.eu/info/departments/international-partnerships_en International Partnerships] (DG INTPA)
* [https://ec.europa.eu/info/departments/european-neighbourhood-policy-and-enlargement-negotiations_en Neighbourhood and Enlargement Negotiations] (DG NEAR)
* [https://ec.europa.eu/info/departments/employment-social-affairs-and-inclusion_en Employment, Social Affairs & Inclusion] (DG EMPL)
Under the EU long-term budget for 2021–2027, EACEA manages parts of the following funding programmes:
* [https://www.eacea.ec.europa.eu/grants/2021-2027/erasmus_en Erasmus+]
* [https://www.eacea.ec.europa.eu/grants/2021-2027/creative-europe_en Creative Europe]
* [https://www.eacea.ec.europa.eu/grants/2021-2027/european-solidarity-corps_en European Solidarity Corps]
* [https://www.eacea.ec.europa.eu/grants/2021-2027/citizens-equality-rights-and-values-cerv_en Citizens, Equality, Rights and Values (CERV)]
* [https://www.eacea.ec.europa.eu/grants/2021-2027/intra-africa-academic-mobility-scheme_en Intra-Africa Academic Mobility Scheme]
Additionally, EACEA supervises the Eurydice network (producing analysis and comparable data on education systems and policies in Europe) and the Youth Wiki (an online encyclopedia of national youth policies across Europe). EACEA also continues to manage projects funded during the 2014–2020 programming period. As of 1 February 2023, the acting director of EACEA is Sophie Beernaerts.
References
External links
* [https://www.eacea.ec.europa.eu/index_en EACEA website]
* [https://www.eacea.ec.europa.eu/grants/2021-2027_en Programming period 2021-2027]
* [https://www.eacea.ec.europa.eu/grants/2014-2020_en Programming period 2014-2020]
